result.execSummary:
The defendant William D Smet was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.
Huber / work release granted for any purpose the Law allows.

Submit a DNA sample (verified it is not on file)
No possession of alcohol or drugs.  
Psychological evaluation, AODA assessment and follow through with recommendation.  
Maintain employment or complete 10 job searches per week.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William D Smet

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant William D Smet in court with attorney Rodman Wells Streicher.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant appears with counsel Rod Streicher and enters a plea of no contest.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  Defendant wants a private PSI completed.  Court will require a PSI completed by our local Probation and Parole Dept. if defendant wants a secondary PSI he will have to get that on his own.  Bond continues with all conditions.
Pre-trial conference on October 1, 2014 at 03:45 pm.
Defendant enters a plea of not guilty.

Defendant William D Smet in court with attorney Steve Brown.  Catharine D White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives prelim on the record.  Court accepts waiver and binds over for immediate arraignment.  DA to file information in 48 hrs consistent with the complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 1, 2014 at 03:45 pm.

Defendant William D Smet in court with attorney Steve Brown.  Scott E Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing requested.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 09:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
for adjournment of initial appearance with counsel.
Defendant William D Smet appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Catharine D White appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
